about.title: About IdeiaSpace
about.description: IdeiaSpace is a Brazilian pioneer company in educational satellites in Brazil and worldwide with satellites in orbit! We connect the world through space technology, revolutionizing education and inspiring the next generation of scientists, engineers and space explorers through real experiences with cutting-edge technology.

technologies.title: Our Technologies
technologies.description: We develop innovative solutions that connect space to the classroom

kit.title: Satellite Kit (Training - SMT)
kit.description:
Distributed to students in Phase 2 for mission prototyping. Includes real subsystems:

• O.B.D.H. (On-Board Computer)
• T.T&C (Communication)
• ADCS (Attitude Control System)
• EPS (Power System)
• Payload (Payload)
• Sensors (Humidity, Temperature, Pressure, etc.)

satellite.title: Orbital Satellite (PocketQube)
satellite.description:
Built by the 30 finalists and launched into space. Specifications:

• Model: PocketQube 1P
• Dimensions: 50x58x64 mm
• Mass: 193 g
• Orbit: LEO (Low Earth Orbit)
• Launch: Partnership with Falcon 9, PSLV, H3.

platform.title: Programming Platform
platform.description: IdeiaSpace provides a complete block programming platform for learning satellite software, within the platform students can program and visualize data from each satellite component using blocks.

deployer.title: Deployer System
deployer.description:
Ejection system developed to release PocketQube satellites into space. Works as an interface between the rocket and satellites, ensuring safe and controlled separation in the desired orbit.

• Capacity: Multiple PocketQubes
• Mechanism: Spring ejection
• Compatibility: PocketQube standard
• Safety: Redundant locking system

spaceChallenge.title: The Space Challenge: From Classroom to Orbit
spaceChallenge.description: The Space Challenge is an Ideia Space project that connects the universe to the classroom. We transform students into protagonists, taking them from mission conception to launching a real satellite.

whySpaceChallenge.title: Why a Space Challenge?
whySpaceChallenge.description1: Brazilian education shows low performance in STEM areas (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics). At the same time, the space sector is expanding and faces a shortage of qualified professionals.
whySpaceChallenge.description2: We believe that the fascination with space can be the spark for an engaging learning experience. We use the space mission as a tool to empower students for the economy of the future.

whatIsChallenge.title: What is the Space Challenge?
whatIsChallenge.description: It is a Space Mission project competition aimed at high school students (14 to 18 years old). The project is designed for one year and impacts different groups of students in progressive stages:

methodology.title: Our Methodology: Learning by Doing
methodology.description: Our philosophy is based on Project-Based Learning (PBL) and the "Hands On" concept. The Space Challenge is structured in a 5-step pedagogical path:

conceive.title: Conceive
conceive.description: Students define the scope and objectives of the mission. They answer: 'What problem will my mission solve?'.

design.title: Design
design.description: Teams detail what the space mission will be like and what resources will be needed.

build.title: Build
build.description: Students explore the satellite development kit (SMT) and bring the mission to life.

launch.title: Launch
launch.description: Selected students build the orbital satellite, conduct tests, and prepare it for launch.

apply.title: Apply
apply.description: With the satellite in orbit, students use its data to solve the problem identified in the mission conception.

impact.title: Our Proven Impact
impact.studentsDesc: We've trained over a thousand students in space technology
impact.satellitesDesc: Satellites designed and built by our students
impact.countriesDesc: Bringing space education to the world

roseno.name: Roseno Gonçalves
roseno.message: I had the opportunity to participate in an Ideia Space course... We were able to work with Arduino and ESP as prototyping platforms for sensors... It was very fun and enlightening.

mariana.name: Mariana Taveira
mariana.message: I participated in the satellite course for high school students... With the help of engineers, we designed our space mission, aiming to solve real problems with nanosatellites. It was an incredible experience that broadened my horizons in the space area.

leadership.title: Meet the Ideia Space Leadership
leadership.description: We are a dedicated partner in training the future workforce for the space sector. Founded in 2022 by specialists with experience at the Brazilian Space Agency and +25 years of combined experience.
